entries.title: Alternative Windows shells, besides CMD.EXE? - Stack Overflow
entries.snippet: It is NOT the program that actually lets you type, displays text, let's you copy and paste, scroll, etc... As one example an alternative to cmd.exe is powershell. Both, by default run in the default windows console. Console alternatives include most of the answers here but they still run cmd.exe.

entries.title: Are there any better command prompts for Windows?
entries.snippet: Microsoft has released the terminal app on Github & the Windows Store, and it has tabs, panels, acrylic transparency, and other features. I now use ConEmu (walkthrough here) which has many features including tabs & split panes. Other options include Cmder (which comes with additional tools built in), and ConsoleZ (a fork of Console2).

entries.title: Microsoft's Edit on Windows is a new command-line text editor
entries.snippet: At its Build conference, Microsoft introduced "Edit on Windows," a lightweight, command-line text editor designed for developers using 64-bit Windows systems. Accessible via the command prompt by typing "edit," the tool allows file editing directly within the terminal, similar to vim, but emphasizes user-friendliness with a modeless interface to avoid complexity for newcomers. The application is open-source, under 250KB in size, and supports features like key bindings for all menu options, multi-file switching with ctrl + P, word wrapping, and advanced find-and-replace with regular expression support. Microsoft created the editor to fill the gap left by the absence of a built-in CLI editor in 64-bit Windows versions, as 32-bit editions included MS-DOS Edit. The editor will be rolled out through the Windows Insider program. Additionally, Microsoft is rebranding Windows Dev Home to Advanced Windows Settings, streamlining developer controls into the main Windows 11 settings interface, including functionality like File Explorer GitHub integration. More detailed information is available on Microsoft's GitHub repository.

entries.title: Microsoft's Command Palette is a powerful launcher for apps, search, and more
entries.snippet: Microsoft has released an updated version of its Spotlight-like launcher for Windows, now called Command Palette, as part of the PowerToys suite. Originally introduced as PowerToys Run nearly five years ago for Windows 10, the new Command Palette builds on that functionality by offering rapid access to apps, files, folders, calculations, system commands, and development tools. It supports launching command prompts, shell shortcuts, websites, and performing file or web searches, targeting power users and developers. One of its standout features is full customizability through extension support, allowing users to expand its utility. Microsoft has also integrated the former Window Walker tool into Command Palette, enabling seamless window switching. While it is intended to replace PowerToys Run, both tools remain available for now. The Command Palette can be activated with the Win+Alt+Space shortcut once installed and has been available since early April. Microsoft made additional adjustments to the tool in preparation for its Build developer conference on May 19.

Windows Terminal
What's Conhost.exe in Windows? What Does it Do?
entries.snippet:
Conhost.exe, also known as Console Windows Host, is a legitimate Windows process that facilitates the Command Prompt's interaction with File Explorer. It allows users to drag and drop files or folders directly into Command Prompt. This process is essential for Windows 7, 8, 10, and 11 and is generally safe and non-virulent. Multiple instances of conhost.exe may run simultaneously, which is normal.

However, a virus can masquerade as conhost.exe, often using misspelled names or incorrect file locations. If it consumes excessive memory or operates from an unusual directory, it may be malicious. To check its authenticity, users can examine conhost.exe's file location via Task Manager, ensuring it resides in the System32 folder. If it appears suspicious, users should remove it by terminating the parent process and using anti-virus tools like Malwarebytes. 

In Windows XP and Vista, conhost.exe is not used, implying any appearance on these systems could indicate a virus. Regular scanning with reliable antivirus software is recommended to prevent infections.

entries.title: What Is Windows Terminal & How Does It Work?
entries.snippet: Windows Terminal is a terminal application from Microsoft that consolidates various command-line utilities like Command Prompt and PowerShell into one program, designed for Windows 10 and 11. It offers multiple features such as multiple tabs, customizable themes, adjustable text settings, and the ability to run as an administrator automatically. Users can open Windows Terminal via the search bar or download it from the Microsoft Store. Terminal opens with PowerShell by default, but users can switch to Command Prompt or Azure Cloud Shell. Settings can be modified easily within the app or through a JSON file for more advanced customization. The default shortcut keys and Command Palette can assist in navigating and using Terminal efficiently. To function, Terminal requires Windows 10 version 18362.0 or higher.

parts:
Depende un poco de qu√© ‚Äúmejor‚Äù quieras decir (m√°s r√°pido, m√°s flexible, mejor interfaz, m√°s extensible, m√°s amigable para scripting, etc.), pero s√≠: hay herramientas que para muchos escenarios resultan ‚Äúmejores que PowerShell‚Äù ‚Äî o al menos complementos que lo superan en ciertas tareas. Aqu√≠ te va un panorama con ventajas, desventajas, y ejemplos:

---

## üßê Qu√© hace fuerte a PowerShell ‚Äî y d√≥nde le cuesta

**Ventajas de PowerShell:**

- Est√° profundamente integrado con Windows, con acceso a APIs .NET, COM, WMI, etc.
- Poder de scripting muy alto: puedes construir automatizaciones complejas.
- Buen ecosistema de m√≥dulos (posiblemente nuevos en PowerShell Core / 7+).
- Soporta objetos en lugar de texto (los comandos devuelven objetos que puedes encadenar).

**Limitaciones donde podr√≠a ‚Äúmejorarse‚Äù:**

- Algunas tareas unix-like (manejo de herramientas de *nix, pipelines de texto) se sienten m√°s naturales con shells de estilo Unix.
- La interfaz de consola (terminal) que viene por defecto en Windows sol√≠a ser bastante b√°sica (aunque esto ha mejorado).  
- Para usuarios acostumbrados a Bash, Zsh o Fish, la sintaxis de PowerShell puede parecer pesada.

Entonces la pregunta no es si ‚Äúhay algo objetivamente mejor‚Äù, sino: ‚Äú¬øalgo que me sirva mejor para *mi* flujo de trabajo?‚Äù  

---

## üîß Alternativas o complementos interesantes

Aqu√≠ algunas buenas opciones que muchos usan en vez de (o junto con) PowerShell:

| Nombre | Qu√© ofrece / en qu√© sobresale | Consideraciones / desventajas |
|---|-------------------------------|-------------------------------|
| **Windows Terminal** | Terminal moderno de Microsoft, con pesta√±as, m√∫ltiples perfiles (cmd, PowerShell, WSL, SSH), soporte para temas y mejoras visuales. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search31ÓàÅ | Solo mejora la interfaz; el ‚Äúmotor‚Äù sigue siendo PowerShell, cmd o shell que elijas. |
| **Cmder** | Emulador de consola con muchas mejoras, combina ConEmu + extensiones, ambiente m√°s agradable. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search3ÓàÇturn0search5ÓàÇturn0search20ÓàÅ | No reemplaza PowerShell internamente; puedes seguir necesitando PowerShell para tareas avanzadas. |
| **ConEmu** | Terminal con pesta√±as, soporte para dividir paneles, muchas opciones visuales. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search2ÓàÇturn0search5ÓàÇturn0search11ÓàÇturn0search20ÓàÅ | De nuevo, es el emulador, no reemplazo del motor de scripting. |
| **Cygwin / MSYS2** | Proporciona entorno tipo Unix dentro de Windows, con muchas utilidades de GNU/Linux. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search2ÓàÇturn0search17ÓàÇturn0search14ÓàÅ | No tendr√° la misma integraci√≥n con los componentes nativos de Windows; algunas cosas van ‚Äúpor fuera‚Äù. |
| **Warp (terminal)** | Terminal moderno con caracter√≠sticas avanzadas (IA, sugerencias, etc.). Ahora ya disponible para Windows tambi√©n. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search26ÓàÅ | Es relativamente nuevo en Windows; la comunidad, compatibilidades y robustez a√∫n est√°n en crecimiento. |
| **Shells alternativos / otros lenguajes de scripting** | Por ejemplo: usar **Python**, **bash** (v√≠a WSL), **AutoIt**, **Batch**, etc. ÓàÄciteÓàÇturn0search22ÓàÇturn0search12ÓàÇturn0search16ÓàÇturn0search18ÓàÅ | Puedes perder integraci√≥n nativa con herramientas de Windows si no haces ‚Äúpuentes‚Äù. |

---

## ‚úÖ Mi opini√≥n: lo ‚Äúmejor‚Äù es h√≠brido

Para m√≠, lo ideal es usar una combinaci√≥n:

- Usa **Windows Terminal** (o Warp) como entorno moderno de consola.
- Para tareas de administraci√≥n de Windows, scripts complejos o componentes .NET, sigue usando PowerShell.
- Para tareas estilo Unix (grep, sed, awk, pipelines de texto), usar√© WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux) o Cygwin.
- Si ves un modelo de shell moderno como Warp con IA o sugerencias que te faciliten el trabajo, es una gran adici√≥n.

---

Si quieres, puedo sugerirte **la mejor opci√≥n para *tu* uso** (scripting, desarrollo, administraci√≥n, etc.). ¬øPara qu√© usas hoy PowerShell t√∫? (o para qu√© te gustar√≠a usar algo ‚Äúmejor‚Äù)
